titleStmt.title: a summary register of wheat land
titleStmt.author: unknown

msContents.summary: The register on this side of the papyrus presents a summary account of all land in the Oxyrhynchite nome devoted to the cultivation of wheat and a short statement of the fiscal revenues due from them.

msItemStruct.note: recto also assigned to Youtie L
Pub. status: Verso; Recto contains two columns of writing of as yet unidentified nature.

condition.ab: This medium brown papyrus is broken on all sides, and a smaller (blank) fragment has been separated to the right. Heavily abraded, especially in the center and along the edges of the sheet, although the text itself has largely remained undamaged.

handDesc.p: Text written in an official semicursive which may be assigned to the third century A.D. The writing occupies a space of approximately 8 cm. in breadth. Free margins remain at the left (approximately 3 cm.), at the top (approx. 2.5 cm.); the margin (excl. the blank fragment) varies at the right, from 0 to 3 cm. At the end of a line, horizontal strokes are often extended to comply with a margin of 0.5 cm. (TC).

origin.origPlace: Oxyrhynchos, Oxyrhynchite nome, Middle Egypt, province of Egypt

provenance.p: Oxyrhynchos, Oxyrhynchite nome, Middle Egypt, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: "Oxyrhynchite nome: ;I (a) All categories 281,278 art. of wheat;Charge of 1/7 40,000 art. of wheat;Total 321,278 art. of wheat.;I (b) Areas determined by inspection;public land, sown 38,857 ar., consisting of:;public land sown 36,609 1/2 1/4 1/8 1/32 ar.;land subject to reduced charges 867 1/4 1/32 ar.;new land 374 1/2 1/4 1/8 ar.;land subject to normal rates . . . 17+ ar.;leased land 939 1/4 1/8 1/16 1/32 ar.; land used from time to time; for dumping refuse 47 1/2 + ; total as aforesaid;II (a) of 3 artabas (per aroura), 116,501 art.;II (b) Private land 163,687 ar., consisting of;private land, sown 159,445 1/4 1/8 1/16 ar.;Vineyards and orchards planted to wheat; and arakos 3,072 1/2 1/4 1/8 1/16 1/32 ar."

listBibl.bibl: Youtie HC, ZPE 32, 237-40, 1978, Pl IV -- SB XIV 12208 -- BL VIII, 379 (date; l. 14)
